subtasks.result:
Ensure the child understands the following toaster safety precautions:
1. Never insert anything other than bread into the toaster.
2. Always unplug the toaster before attempting to remove stuck items.
3. Wait for the toaster to cool down before cleaning it.
4. Never touch the toaster with wet hands.
5. Use caution when handling hot toast or items that come out of the toaster.

subtasks.title: Demonstrate safe toaster operation
subtasks.description: Demonstrate how to safely plug in and operate the toaster.
subtasks.expected_output: Child learns how to operate the toaster safely.

=== PROJECT ===
Title: Teach a child how to make toast safely.


=== AREA ===
Title: Safety
Description: Focuses on explaining safety precautions and potential hazards to the child.




=== CURRENT TASK ===
Title: Demonstrate safe toaster operation
Description: Demonstrate how to safely plug in and operate the toaster.
Expected Output: Child learns how to operate the toaster safely.



=== INSTRUCTION ===
You are responsible for completing the current task as part of the overall project.
Use all available context, including dependency and previous results, but present your answer as your own expert recommendation or decision.

subtasks.result: Demonstrate how to safely plug in the toaster by showing the child how to insert the plug into a nearby electrical outlet. Ensure the child understands the importance of plugging the toaster directly into the outlet and not using any extension cords or adapters. Demonstrate how to operate the toaster by setting the desired level of toasting and pressing the lever down to start the toasting process. Emphasize the importance of never inserting any objects other than bread into the toaster and always supervising the toasting process.

result.Explain toaster safety:
Ensure the child understands the following toaster safety precautions:
1. Never insert anything other than bread into the toaster.
2. Always unplug the toaster before attempting to remove stuck items.
3. Wait for the toaster to cool down before cleaning it.
4. Never touch the toaster with wet hands.
5. Use caution when handling hot toast or items that come out of the toaster.
result.Demonstrate safe toaster operation: Demonstrate how to safely plug in the toaster by showing the child how to insert the plug into a nearby electrical outlet. Ensure the child understands the importance of plugging the toaster directly into the outlet and not using any extension cords or adapters. Demonstrate how to operate the toaster by setting the desired level of toasting and pressing the lever down to start the toasting process. Emphasize the importance of never inserting any objects other than bread into the toaster and always supervising the toasting process.

subtasks.title: Guidance
subtasks.description: Provides step-by-step instructions on how to make toast, ensuring the child follows each step correctly.
subtasks.expected_output: The child successfully makes toast following the provided instructions.
responsibilities: Instruct the child on how to insert bread into the toaster.
Guide the child on setting the toaster and pressing the toast button.

subtasks.title: Instruct on inserting bread
subtasks.description: Guide the child on how to properly insert bread slices into the toaster.
subtasks.expected_output: Child correctly inserts bread into the toaster.

subtasks.result: Ensure the toaster is unplugged. Hold a bread slice by the edges and gently slide it into the toaster slot until it reaches the bottom. Repeat with the second slice if necessary. Be careful not to touch the inside of the toaster to avoid burns. Once both slices are inserted, plug in the toaster and proceed with toasting.

subtasks.title: Set toaster settings
subtasks.description: Explain to the child how to select the desired toast shade and set the timer on the toaster.
subtasks.expected_output: Child sets the toaster to the desired settings.

subtasks.result: Instruct the child to locate the "toast" button on the toaster and press it to initiate the toasting cycle. Remind them to be careful and not touch the toaster's hot surfaces during or after the toasting process.

result.Instruct on inserting bread: Ensure the toaster is unplugged. Hold a bread slice by the edges and gently slide it into the toaster slot until it reaches the bottom. Repeat with the second slice if necessary. Be careful not to touch the inside of the toaster to avoid burns. Once both slices are inserted, plug in the toaster and proceed with toasting.
result.Set toaster settings: Explain to the child that to set the toaster settings, they need to turn the shade control dial to the desired level of toastiness. Then, instruct them to set the timer to the appropriate duration for the type of bread they are using. Encourage them to double-check the settings before starting the toaster.
result.Press toast button: Instruct the child to locate the "toast" button on the toaster and press it to initiate the toasting cycle. Remind them to be careful and not touch the toaster's hot surfaces during or after the toasting process.

subtasks.title: Supervision
subtasks.description: Involves overseeing the child while they make toast, ready to intervene if needed.
subtasks.expected_output: The child completes the task safely under supervision.
responsibilities: Monitor the child's actions during the toasting process.
Be prepared to assist or intervene in case of any issues.

subtasks.title: Monitor toasting process
subtasks.description: Watch the child as they toast the bread, ensuring they follow the instructions correctly and operate the toaster safely.
subtasks.expected_output: Child follows the toasting process without any safety issues.

subtasks.result: Ensure the child places the bread slices in the toaster slots, selects the desired toasting level, and presses the toaster's start button. Monitor closely to ensure the child does not attempt to touch the toaster while it's in operation. Once the toasting is complete, supervise the child as they remove the toast using safe utensils and unplug the toaster. Verify that the child follows these steps without any safety issues.

subtasks.title: Be ready to intervene
subtasks.description: Stay close to the child while they toast the bread, ready to step in and assist if they face any difficulties or make a mistake.
subtasks.expected_output: Immediate intervention if needed to prevent accidents.

Preparation.Gather necessary items: Collect bread, toaster, butter, knife, and plate for making toast and place them on the workspace.
Preparation.Set up workspace: Clear the workspace of any obstacles or hazards. Place the collected bread, toaster, butter, knife, and plate on the workspace in an organized manner for easy access. Ensure that everything is within reach and ready for the child to start making toast safely.

Safety.Explain toaster safety:
Ensure the child understands the following toaster safety precautions:
1. Never insert anything other than bread into the toaster.
2. Always unplug the toaster before attempting to remove stuck items.
3. Wait for the toaster to cool down before cleaning it.
4. Never touch the toaster with wet hands.
5. Use caution when handling hot toast or items that come out of the toaster.
Safety.Demonstrate safe toaster operation: Demonstrate how to safely plug in the toaster by showing the child how to insert the plug into a nearby electrical outlet. Ensure the child understands the importance of plugging the toaster directly into the outlet and not using any extension cords or adapters. Demonstrate how to operate the toaster by setting the desired level of toasting and pressing the lever down to start the toasting process. Emphasize the importance of never inserting any objects other than bread into the toaster and always supervising the toasting process.

Guidance.Instruct on inserting bread: Ensure the toaster is unplugged. Hold a bread slice by the edges and gently slide it into the toaster slot until it reaches the bottom. Repeat with the second slice if necessary. Be careful not to touch the inside of the toaster to avoid burns. Once both slices are inserted, plug in the toaster and proceed with toasting.
Guidance.Set toaster settings: Explain to the child that to set the toaster settings, they need to turn the shade control dial to the desired level of toastiness. Then, instruct them to set the timer to the appropriate duration for the type of bread they are using. Encourage them to double-check the settings before starting the toaster.
Guidance.Press toast button: Instruct the child to locate the "toast" button on the toaster and press it to initiate the toasting cycle. Remind them to be careful and not touch the toaster's hot surfaces during or after the toasting process.

Supervision.Monitor toasting process: Ensure the child places the bread slices in the toaster slots, selects the desired toasting level, and presses the toaster's start button. Monitor closely to ensure the child does not attempt to touch the toaster while it's in operation. Once the toasting is complete, supervise the child as they remove the toast using safe utensils and unplug the toaster. Verify that the child follows these steps without any safety issues.
Supervision.Be ready to intervene: Immediate intervention if needed to prevent accidents.
